full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 751 Filed 08/10/22 Page 109 of 261 1270
LC6Cmax3 Kate - cross
1 Q. And that was your employment during that period of time that you became a mother?
2 A. Which period of time specifically?
3 Q. Well, I don't want to go into the details, but there came a point where you delivered a baby; correct?
4 A. Yes.
5 Q. And you were employed at that time?
6 A. Yes.
7 Q. And you also sought support from the government during that period of time so you could stay home with your child?
8 A. Yes.
9 Q. And even though you are employed, you sought benefits from the government so you could stay home?
10 A. What do you mean even though I was employed?
11 Q. Well, I asked you if you were employed at that period of time. You said you were working for a residence; correct?
12 A. No. No, I wasn't working for that then. I lived there. I was working for another company.
13 Q. What company? You don't have to tell me the name of it, just tell me what type of company it was.
14 A. It was a financial company.
15 Q. So you were working for a financial company at the time you gave birth, yet you requested public assistance so you could stay home with your child?
16 A. Yes.
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00018446
